item.title: 8 Best Gradient Attacks In Clair Obscur Expedition 33, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Unique Gradient Attacks in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 offer strategic advantages beyond just dealing damage.
  • Gradient Attacks like Sanctuary and Tree of Life focus on healing and support, essential for success in battles.
  • Break Point and Tremor Gradient Attacks provide offensive power and utility, perfect for breaking shields and dealing high damage.

Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 has a lot of mechanics that evolve as the game goes on. For example, it seems at first that players can only use Dodge or Parry to negate an enemy attack, but then a jump-based version will unlock later, and that's not all.

There is a system in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 similar to Final Fantasy's Limit Breaks, wherein players can charge a shared meter among the party to use powerful skills called Gradient Attacks. Despite the name, not all Gradient Attacks are offensive. Of the party members in the game, players can unlock fifteen Gradient Attacks, and these are the ones that stand out the most, which will be ranked by their usefulness.

8 Doom

Dark Damage To One Target And Applies Debuffs

  • Character: Sciel

The Doom Gradient Attack belongs to Sciel, and it can do a high amount of dark-based damage to one enemy, which is great if the enemy is weak to dark attacks. More importantly, it will imbue the enemy with several of Clair Obscur: Expedition 33’s status effects and apply Powerless, Defenceless, and Slow for a few turns.

Powerless will weaken its attacks, Defenceless will lower its defenses, and Slow will reduce its speed, meaning that it will have fewer turns during battle. It’s a good Gradient Attack for strategists out there.

7 Sanctuary

Applies Regen And Two Shields To Party

  • Character: Monoco

The Sanctuary Gradient Attack will not do any damage at all and is instead a supportive skill for Monoco. It will apply Regen to the party, which will heal them on every turn for a few rounds, which is a great way to heal in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 .

The other effect will give characters two Shields, and Shields in general can absorb complete damage for a solid hit. Once a Shield is hit, it will disappear, but they are nice to have in a pinch.

6 Tree Of Life

Heal HP And Status Effects For All

  • Character: Lune

The Tree of Life Gradient Attack is another supportive type, and Lune can learn this one. It will heal the party a good amount and, more importantly, it will remove pesky status effects like Powerless, which can lower attack power.

It’s easily one of the best healing skills in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 , and players may choose to save Gradient charges just to have this on the back burner. It may get used a lot in battle, but it is far from the coolest Gradient Attack in the game.

5 Tremor

Earth Damage Targets All And Breaks Shields

  • Character: Lune

The Tremor Gradient Attack is another one for Lune, and this one is an offensive type. It will target all enemies on the battlefield and strike them with high earth-based damage. Unfortunately, not many enemies are weak to earth-based attacks, but that’s not what makes Tremor good in the first place.

It will also remove every Shield the enemy party has with just one attack, which is huge for bosses or certain enemy types who like to apply Shields a lot like those sacrificial knights in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33’s Stone Wave Cliffs.

4 Break Point

High Damage To One Target And Can Break Them

  • Character: Monoco

The Break Point Gradient Attack is another one for Monoco, and this one is an offensive type. It will target one enemy and do a great deal of damage, which is nice, but not the major perk. The Gradient Attack will automatically apply Break no matter where the enemy’s Break meter is.

Broken enemies in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 can lose a turn, buffs applied to them, and can take more damage, which is most useful against very tricky enemies like the many optional Mime bosses.

3 Gommage

The Ultimate Insult

  • Character: Maelle

The entirety of Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 revolves around characters being Gommaged, which means they get erased from existence based on their age. To avoid direct spoilers, let’s just say that Maelle gets the power to Gommage certain foes within the story.

Eventually, players can get the Gommage Gradient Attack to use whenever they want in battle with Maelle. On weaker foes, it will kill them automatically, but on stronger enemies, like bosses, they will take an absurd amount of damage instead.

2 Angel's Eyes

High Damage To One Target, Raises Perfection, And Applies Auto Revive To Verso

  • Character: Verso

The Angel's Eyes Gradient Attack is the one good one for Verso, which deals a great amount of damage to one foe and hits it multiple times. Verso’s specialty is called Perfection, which is a letter-based grade system that starts at D and goes up to S in a descending order, which is typical in Japanese games, albeit confusing from an alphabetical perspective.

Angel’s Eyes will raise Verso’s grade with each hit, basically guaranteeing to get up to rank S after the attack, and ranks will boost attack power. Also, Verso can withstand death once during battle as if an angel is watching over him.

1 Phoenix Flame

Burn Enemies And Revive Allies

  • Character: Maelle

The Phoenix Flame Gradient Attack is a great one for a very specific situation, but still amazing on a grand scale. If Maelle is alone in a party after witnessing her teammates die, Phoenix Flame will resurrect them with a good amount of health.

It will also apply a large stack of Burn status effects onto an enemy, and players use their builds for Maelle right in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 , they can absolutely dominate a boss by using Burn and fire-based attacks. That’s the biggest reason why this Gradient Attack is useful, but hopefully, players won’t go through losing two party members often.

Your comment has not been saved

Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
37
9.7 /10

item.title: Ghost of Yotei Jumps to Top of PlayStation Pre-Order Chart
item.description:
Summary

  • Ghost of Yotei is currently at the top of the PlayStation Store pre-order charts in the US, UK, and several other territories.
  • The title will be set 300 years after the events of Ghost of Tsushima.
  • Ghost of Yotei will be released for PS5 on October 2.

Ghost of Yotei is currently at the top of the PlayStation Store pre-order charts in the US and UK. Sucker Punch officially revealed the upcoming sequel to the 2020 open-world action title Ghost of Tsushima back in September 2024, confirming that it will have both a new name and a new central protagonist. Taking place 300 years after the events of the first game, Ghost of Yotei follows Atsu, who embarks on a mission to avenge the murder of her family by hunting the people responsible across Japan’s northern Enzo region.

Fans of the original Ghost of Tsushima got another look at Ghost of Yotei last month, along with an official release date of October 2. Much of the classic action and stealth gameplay that made Ghost of Tsushima a hit will be retained in Ghost of Yotei , with Atsu shown cutting down enemies using the same katana that pinned her to a tree as the sinister Yotei Six burned down her home. Ghost of Yotei will also take advantage of its new time period by giving Astu a matchlock rifle to shoot at foes from a distance.

Gamers are excited to see more of the new direction that Sucker Punch is taking with Ghost of Yotei , at least according to the high number of pre-orders already in the books. Ghost of Yotei is currently at the very top of the PlayStation Store pre-order charts in the US, UK, and other territories (as reported by PushSquare), with the $80 Deluxe Edition ranking slightly higher than the vanilla $70 version. Pre-orders for Ghost of Yotei started late last week, roughly six months away from its October 2 launch on the PlayStation 5.

Ghost of Yotei Tops PlayStation Store Pre-Order Chart

Ghost of Tsushima was already a blockbuster success for the PlayStation 4, with an updated PS5 version released in 2021 and a PC port launching in 2024. A live-action Ghost of Tsushima movie by John Wick director Chad Stahelski is in development from Sony, as is an anime inspired by the game’s online multiplayer mode Ghost of Tsushima: Legends .

This success is already spreading to Ghost of Yotei , with many players already pre-ordering the next chapter in Sucker Punch’s open-world samurai series. Ghost of Yotei will depart from its predecessor in many ways, such as having a non-linear story campaign. Former PlayStation and Sony executive Shuhei Yoshida recently praised Ghost of Yotei for providing a smooth and bug-free gameplay experience and expressed excitement to see the full game once it launches this fall.

item.title: What Could 2026's PlayStation Lineup Look Like?
item.description:
The past couple of years have been rather quiet for PlayStation's tentpole first-party releases. 2023 saw the launch of Insomniac Games' Spider-Man 2 , and PlayStation went the entirety of 2024 without releasing a major AAA first-party game. Astro Bot and Helldivers 2 turned out surprise phenomenons, of course, but they weren't positioned as $70 blockbusters like God of War and Horizon . 2022 has featured PlayStation's best first-party lineup this console generation so far, with heavy hitters like Gran Turismo 7 , Horizon Forbidden West , God of War Ragnarok , and The Last of Us Part 1 all releasing within the year.

So far, 2025 looks to be on the lighter side for PS5 first-party games as well, with only Ghost of Yotei confirmed for launch on October 2. Death Stranding 2: On the Beach is another major PS5 exclusive for 2025, but it technically isn't a full-blown first-party game since the Death Stranding IP belongs to developer Kojima Productions. There are murmurings of a God of War side project that's slated for launch later this year, but it's yet to be officially confirmed. This begs the question of what 2026 could hold for fans of PlayStation's first-party games.

PlayStation's 2026 Game Lineup is Poised to Be One of Its Best Yet for the PS5 Generation

Sony is very secretive about what PlayStation's in-house studios are working on, and the reveal-to-release timeline for PS5 first-party games is usually pretty unpredictable, too. For instance, Astro Bot was unveiled in May 2024, just four months before its September 2024 launch, whereas Ghost of Yotei broke cover in September 2024 and is set to launch just over one year later. Moreover, Naughty Dog revealed Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet in December 2024 with no indication of when the game will be released. However, there are a few PlayStation first-party games that seem primed for 2026 launches.

Rumors suggest Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet won't be out before 2027.

Housemarque's Saros is the Only PS5 First-Party Game Confirmed for 2026 So Far

Just a few months ago, Housemarque formally announced its next game, Saros , at PlayStation's inaugural State of Play for 2025. Saros is a brand-new IP that builds upon the highly acclaimed roguelike mechanics of Housemarque's 2021 hit Returnal . However, Saros will feature a key gameplay distinction in that resources and progression will be retained after each run. Housemarque also confirmed an "ensemble NPC cast" for Saros , hinting at a greater narrative focus, while Returnal was more isolated in that regard. Saros is scheduled to launch in 2026 , and Housemarque will show off gameplay later this year.

Haven Studios' Fairgames May Finally Launch Next Year

Fairgames is the debut title of nascent PlayStation team Haven Studios. Formed by Assassin's Creed veteran Jade Raymond and acquired by Sony in 2022, Haven Studios revealed Fairgames during the 2023 PlayStation Showcase as a live-service PvP heist game, where players compete in teams to steal from billionaires and the like. The cinematic trailer didn't provide much information about Fairgames ' gameplay mechanics, nor did Haven confirm a release window. However, rumors have alleged that Fairgames is internally targeting a 2026 release. Should that be true, new details about Fairgames might drop later this year.

There's Reason to Believe Insomniac's Wolverine is Coming in 2026

Inarguably the Sony first-party title that's most overdue for more news, Insomniac's Marvel's Wolverine was announced during the 2021 PlayStation Showcase and has gone nearly four years without a meaningful update. Pre-alpha footage of Wolverine , as well as story details and casting info, did leak online in late 2023 as part of the devastating Insomniac data breach. Alongside these, Insomniac's entire game roadmap for the next decade also leaked, which pegged Wolverine for a 2026 launch . It remains to be seen if the data breach impacted Wolverine 's release schedule, but 2026 shouldn't be ruled out for now.

Could PlayStation Have a Surprise or Two Up Its Sleeve?

While Saros , Wolverine , and Fairgames comprise a robust first-party trio, it's worth taking a look at some rumored PlayStation projects that could join them in 2026. Chief among these is another live-service title - a Horizon co-op multiplayer game that has been in development at Guerrilla Games for several years. Given the amount of time the Horizon co-op game has been in the works, it wouldn't be unfathomable for Guerrilla to be targeting launch next year, if not 2025 itself.

Additionally, Horizon: Call of the Mountain and The Persistence developer Firesprite has long been rumored to be developing Until Dawn 2 . The new ending sequences in 2024's Until Dawn remake also tease a story continuation, further lending credence to the prospect of a sequel for the horror game. With summer approaching and lots of publishers and platform holders gearing up to reveal new games, one can only hope that PlayStation will hold a full-blown Showcase and give fans some clarity for 2026 and beyond.

item.title: Assassin's Creed Shadows Reveals Update 1.0.4 Patch Notes
item.description:
Summary

  • Ubisoft released Title Update 1.0.4 for Assassin's Creed Shadows, adding new content and fixing multiple bugs.
  • The update brings the new story "The Works of Luis Frois" and character bios in the Codex database for gamers.
  • Fans can expect more updates and content in the future, such as a new expansion and a rumored multiplayer mode.

Ubisoft has released the new Title Update 1.0.4 for Assassin’s Creed Shadows , which brings new content and fixes multiple bugs in the popular open-world game. This new patch marks a good time for gamers to return to Assassin’s Creed Shadows , as Ubisoft keeps polishing the experience.

Released back in March, Assassin’s Creed Shadows was a big hit. While Ubisoft has not released official numbers on how much the title sold, Assassin’s Creed Shadows often appears at the top of sales charts. Also, the title received positive reviews from critics, with AC Shadows having an average critic score of 81 on OpenCritic.

Now, Ubisoft has released the lengthy Title Update 1.0.4 for Assassin’s Creed Shadows , which is already available for all platforms. The main highlight of the update is the new “The Works of Luis Frois” story, which will allow gamers to learn more about the Jesuits as they encounter Luis Frois and protect Lady Satoko. AC Shadows also received a new Codex update, and character bios have been added to the database, helping gamers to remember important NPCs. Apart from these additions, the patch fixed dozens of bugs, ranging from general bugs to graphic glitches or issues specific to some platforms.

Fortunately, fans still have much to look forward to in the next updates for Ubisoft’s latest release. Last month, Ubisoft unveiled the official road map for Assassin’s Creed Shadows , detailing what’s coming up in the next few months. In late May, for example, gamers can expect a new update focused on improving parkour and the addition of Photo Mode, while in June, the title will get more difficulty settings, a free new quest will be added, and more. Sometime later in 2025, the “Claws of Awaji” expansion will be released.

Some recent rumors even indicated that Assassin’s Creed Shadows could eventually get a multiplayer mode. According to dataminers, the game’s files indicate mentions of multiplayer and PvP maps. However, Ubisoft has not confirmed that this feature will be added at the time of this report.

Other rumors indicate that nine Assassin’s Creed games could be released in the next six years, marking a busy release cycle for the franchise. While some of these titles include remakes, like the long-rumored AC4: Black Flag remake, this is still an impressive number, and it includes some projects fans already know about, such as Assassin’s Creed Hexe , as well as other more mysterious projects, such as a multiplayer game.

Assassin's Creed Shadows Title Update 4

Patch Sizes

PS5: 4.67 GB

XBS: 20 GB

MAC: ~9 GB

PC: 17 GB

Steam: 8.5 GB

Patch Highlights

New Free Story Pack: The Works of Luis Frois

An encounter with Luis Frois at a Jesuit Mission turns into an opportunity to help an old friend. Retrieve lost notes, protect Lady Satoko and learn more about the Jesuits in this new Free Story Pack playable with both Naoe or Yasuke.

To meet with Luis Frois and start the quest arc, head to Azuchi. Luis will be located south of the Merchants’ Quarters. The quest will be available upon completing “The Path he Walks”, in Yasuke’s Board.

Codex Update: Character Entries

As requested by many, we have added character bios in the Codex database to help you keep track of the many allies and foes you will meet throughout your journey in Japan.

LIST OF BUG FIXES

General

  • Fixed an issue when pressing "Go to board" for "Complete Yasuke's personal journey" does not redirect the player to Yasuke's quest board.
  • Fixed an issue where some trinkets could not be accessed in the Forge.
  • Fixed some issues where visual customization could not be applied to certain weapons.
  • Fixed a visual issue with the Red Bull trinket swapping between Yasuke and Naoe.
  • Addressed several AI issues.
  • Addressed several audio issues.

World

  • All props near an altar or a religion building will now be static, preventing any destruction.
  • Fixed an issue where too many deer spawning and running on main roads. Oh dear, watch out!
  • Merchants will no longer offer multiple instances of the same item in shops.
  • Fixed an issue where buying and equipping head gear would kick you from the merchant menu.

Quests

  • Fixed an issue where in the quest “Astray”, players could not talk To Nakamura Tadashige.
  • NOTE: Players will need to step away from Nakamura Tadashige (+500 meters) and then come back to speak with them.
  • Fixed an issue where Nagato would sometimes not follow the correct path in the prologue during the "Fight of the Kakushiba Ikki" quest.
  • Fixed an issue where Momochi Sandayu does not attack during the objective "Kill the Soldier" in the "Fight of the Kakushiba Ikki" quest.
  • Fixed an issue where Nagato would despawn after a save/load during the quest "The Onryo Samurai".
  • A prompt will now properly appear to Observe during the objective "Reach a high place to observe the Onryo Samurai" in the quest "The Onryo Samurai".
  • Addressed an issue with enemy NPCs fighting each other after talking to Shotei during "Against the Koga-ryu".
  • Fixed an issue where Tokubei would start attacking anyone that enters conflict with the player during the "Confront Tokubei" objective of "Losing Hand" quest.
  • Fixed an issue where quest directions do not match the quest location during the "Meet Katsuhime" objective of "Against the Koga-ryu" quest.
  • Addressed an issue where Yasuke would recover all of his health upon receiving a killing blow from Marume Nagayoshi during the duel from "Nobutsaha's Students".

Stealth

  • Fixed an issue where Improved Ground Assassination (Assassin passive skill) would not work properly.
  • Fixed an issue where Assassinations would not remove any health from knocked-out enemies.
  • Fixed an issue where, after performing a Double Assassination, Naoe could not swap weapons if she was using the Katana as primary weapon.
  • Fixed an issue with Yasuke’s Brutal Assassination not triggering at a certain distance with NPCs.
  • Fixed Guaranteed Assassination not working with the kunai.
  • Fixed an issue where Naoe could use smoke bombs to trigger Guaranteed Assassination opportunities on bosses.
  • Fixed an issue where crouching during a Sprint Dodge would increase the speed of the crouch state.
  • Fixed an issue where Naoe had a delay when crouching after moving while aiming a tool.
  • Fixed an issue where corner cover camera would not always trigger.
  • Fixed an issue with alarm bells respawning after cutscenes. Please don't ring. Please don't ring. Please don't ring.

Combat

  • Adjusted the Igan Sunset Tanto perk (i.e. slow down time on Escape Strike) to prevent endless slow-down when using Escape Strike repeatedly.
  • The perk now works as follows: “Slow down time after Escape Strike interrupts enemies”
  • Fixed an issue with the Snake Bite ability (Kusarigama) costing more than one chunk of adrenaline. Two fangs. But one bite.
  • Fixed an issue where the "Crescent Strike” ability (Naginata) did not deal any damage on its first hit.
  • Fixed various issues with perks not functioning correctly.
  • Fixed an issue where letters displayed on screen would not automatically close when the player would enter conflict. Listen I’m just trying to read here.
  • Fixed an issue where Naoe cannot dodge if she first attacks the Ashigaru Swordsman with a posture attack during "Fight of the Kakushiba Ikki" quest.
  • Fixed an issue where the ability wheel would still display the abilities from the previously equipped weapon when being unarmed.

Visuals & Graphics

  • Fixed several animation, visual or misplacement issues.
  • Fixed various rendering issues.

UI & HUD

  • Addressed various UI/HUD issues.
  • Addressed localization issues.
  • Fixed an issue with the tutorial explaining how to use boats. How do you row this thing?
  • Fixed an issue where the four targets of the Pirate Alliance were not aligned on the Objective Board.
  • Fixed an issue where the drop-down list is missing for "Text Color" and "Background Color" options in the Captions menu.

Photo Mode

  • Fixed various visual issues with Photo Mode.
  • Fixed an issue where the last known position visual effect remained visible in Photo Mode.
  • Fixed an issue where the Codex Orbs remained present in Photo Mode.
  • Fixed an issue where the vignette effect size increases when decreasing the value in Photo Mode.

Hideout

  • Fixed an issue where the blacksmith was missing from the hideout. I must upgrade my weapons!
  • Fixed an issue where some trinkets could not be accessed in the Forge.

Stability & Performances

  • Addressed various crashing and stability issues.

Platform-Specific issues

Xbox

  • Fixed an issue where the "Balanced" mode was missing in the Performance options.

PC

  • VRAM usage is now added to the performance overlay when using the benchmark tool.
  • Improved description in the Scalability options to better reflect the impact on CPU and GPU.
  • Addressed an issue with conflicting bindings for mouse & keyboard on PC.
  • Fixed an issue where the VRAM meter doesn't accurately update the VRAM usage when settings are individually changed.
  • Addressed an issue with PC using Photo Mode with the Ultra-wide screen settings.

STEAMDECK

  • Addressed an issue where there was a heavy loss of FPS in the opening animation before arriving at the Animus HUB (memories).

MacOS

  • Fixed an issue where the resolution options are all "Custom" when the game is in windowed mode on macOS.
  • VRAM usage added to the performance overlay.
  • Addressed an issue with the PS5® DUALSENSE® controller lightbar not emitting the correct light on macOS.

item.title: Rumor: A New Genshin Impact Game Could Be in Development
item.description:
Summary

  • Genshin Impact may get an Animal Crossing-inspired spin-off in the future.
  • It's unclear when this title will come to fruition, but several well-known leakers have pointed towards its existence.
  • HoYoverse recently announced a new Honkai title inspired by Pokemon.

According to a recent leak, Genshin Impact could be getting a spin-off title inspired by Animal Crossing , as HoYoverse continues to grow its franchises. Between Honkai: Star Rail and Zenless Zone Zero , it's clear that HoYoverse isn't one to rest on its laurels after the overwhelming success of Genshin Impact . As seen from the many Flagship Events in Genshin Impact , the developers are interested in fiddling with a lot of different genres.

Some of these minigames have eventually spawned permanent content in Genshin Impact , with the most recent example being the Repertoire of Myriad Melodies. However, there exists a more ambitious spark at HoYoverse, as the company recently unveiled a new Honkai title inspired by Pokemon . While the teaser did not reveal the new game's name, HoYoverse told its fans to "stay tuned" for more information.

In a similar vein, there are rumors circulating in the Genshin Impact community that a spin-off title is being developed by HoYoverse, seemingly inspired by Nintendo's Animal Crossing . This information has been shared by both hxg_diluc and Seele Leaks, which further adds to its legitimacy. The leak also provided "Genshin Impact: Thousand Stars Domain" and "Genshin: Thousand Planets" as potential names for the new title.

HoYoverse Could Be Making a Genshin Impact Game Inspired by Animal Crossing

It should be noted that the Animal Crossing project could be a different game entirely, as earlier leaks point towards the project having "Astaweave Haven" as its title. However, given the timeline of the rumors, there is a strong possibility that this new project will indeed take place in the Genshnin Impact universe. As a concept, the genre could allow different Genshin Impact characters to shine, especially NPCs and lore figures such as Enjou, Jeht, or Xbalanque. Players should temper their expectations, as it may likely be years until the project comes to fruition.

The project could end up being a valuable addition to HoYoverse's portfolio of games, especially given the popularity that Genshin Impact accumulated over the years. Teyvat is a beloved setting, and Genshin Impact shows no signs of slowing down as it sets the stage for Nod-Krai, a region that will almost entirely focus on tying up loose ends. While players haven't been too happy with the way Genshin Impact handled map expansions in Natlan, the community remains excited to see Skirk, Dahlia, and Mare Jivari. Unfortunately, fans will have to wait until Version 5.8 for Mare Jivari, but Skirk and Dahlia should be available when Version 5.7 launches on June 18, 2025.
